channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-21641] Llap external client returns decimal columns in different precision/scale as compared to beeline
item.description:
Llap external client gives different precision/scale as compared to when the query is executed beeline. Consider the following results:

Query:

 
select avg(ss_ext_sales_price) my_avg from store_sales;

 

Result from Beeline

 
+----------------------------+
|           my_avg           |
+----------------------------+
| 37.8923531030581611189434  |
+----------------------------+

 

Result from Llap external client

+---------+
|   my_avg|
+---------+
|37.892353|
+---------+

 
This is due to Driver(beeline path) calls analyzeInternal() for getting result set schema which initializes resultSchema after some more transformations as compared to llap-ext-client which calls genLogicalPlan()

Replacing genLogicalPlan() by analyze() resolves this.
item.summary: Llap external client returns decimal columns in different precision/scale as compared to beeline

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12968009 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

I think changing this to {{analyze.analyze}] kinda takes away the original benefits of doing this in the first place...by doing a full analyze it will do a bit more than just logical planning

I think it might worth a try to fix this the other way around - and make sure that genLogicalPlan ends up with the correct type....

cc: jcamachorodriguez

I think kgyrtkirk is right. The main reason to use genLogicalPlan in llap-ext-client was to avoid the overhead of using a complete analyze over the query. If type is different, there may be another underlying issue...

Thanks kgyrtkirk jcamachorodriguez
I have opened https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-22541
